summary: The Edo period (1603-1868) was a time of peace and growth in Japan. It was ruled by the Tokugawa shogunate and local lords called daimyo. This era followed a time of war and was known for its strict rules, isolation from other countries, and a thriving culture in the city of Edo (now Tokyo). The shogunate was established by Tokugawa Ieyasu, and the period ended with the Meiji Restoration, when Japan's emperor took back power.
title: Edo period
